Эта игра мне не когда не надоест, сколько бы я её не перепроходил она божественна, да в ней есть косяки, ну и что она стоит своих денег, она меня затянула на 3-4 часа. Посмотрите на её карточки, а на достижения они прекрасны. Заметил недавно, карточки хл 2 дорого для кого то стоят, одна карта 3-5 рублей ГРАБЁЖ, но оно того стоило, я не знаю что ещё написать про эту игру да в ней есть баги, хрен с ним что на глав. странице один видеоролик не совпадает с игрой т.к в видео было видно как он (Гордон) меняет оружие на дробовук из бетки версии, а в игре его нет, нас обманули, хотя игруля вышла в 2004 году, фу не культурно получается, ну мы канешн все забьём нам же всрать, шо габен такой ленивый или кто там эту баганную шарманку делал, а музыка вот Keilly Beiley умеет делать музон, начинается махач и тут *туц* *туц* *туц*. Лан фиг с ним, он норм чел наверно.
Стоит ли халфу покупать? Определённо нет, она же кишит в багах, да я там писал, что она мне не надоест, так я привык к говну, я же русский, мы же все такие, живём в говне, привыкли к нему, оно не кусается хоть. Лучше пиратку, тогда можно, а так вы не вернёте свои 260 рублей, - жизнь - деньги с завтраков....

[h1] An absolute must play. [/h1]

Although it took me a year to come back to it after getting stuck on a stupidly easy section in Ravenholm, I can safely say this is my absolute favourite title and probably some of the best the videogame industry can offer.

This simple-looking FPS was the revolution of its genre back in the day and still proudly stays as a standard for most modern titles. To really understand why, it is always best to experience it by yourself but I will try to briefly summarise the main aspects of the game and what makes it so special.

Lets start off with what is, in my opinion, the most polished aspect of this title: the level design and environment. The claustrophobic and decayed look of HL2's levels really goes to show the lengthy creation process this game had to undergo, its pretty impressive how the developers managed to squeeze so much content and gameplay into very tight spaces and narrow structures (be it to save on resources or to flesh out the world). Every building is very intuitively thought through and constantly shows you new paths that lead to new rooms filled with well placed enemies and props that you can use to your advantage, as well as some simple puzzles here and there to sort of show off the impressive capabilities of the Source engine (for its time obviously) which still holds up really well both in graphics and physics. All this neatly combined with the worn and rough aspect of modern Eastern European architecture, surfaces and various objects that immerse you into the experience.  

As for any other FPS game the gunplay is one of Half-Life 2's pillars and I wouldn't say Valve nails this completely (at least by today's standards) but it is pretty solid too. Each weapon provided feels polished, special and satisfying to shoot and can be used at nearly any given moment which makes for some interesting gunfights. Using the gravity gun is encouraged too as it is very fun and rewarding, spicing up each encounter.

The story is engaging and constantly pushing you further while having some very interesting lore. The characters feel alive and human, with defects and virtues that make them relatable. The music is the cherry on top, energizing you in combat and immersing you in the more cinematic moments, it is also great to listen on its own.

This game never frustrated or infuriated me and constantly rewarded me for my exploration, curiosity and observation, something that I absolutely loved. It aged like fine wine and deserves just as much praise as it got back in its day. 

In conclusion, I would like to end this review with the same words I started it with, [b]its an absolute must play[/b].

[h1]Nunca possuí um computador de ultima geração por assim dizer, mas já joguei vários games clássicos e que sem sombra de dúvidas marcaram toda uma geração. Certa vez estava procurando um game leve e ao mesmo tempo com um bom enredo para meu entretenimento, eis que me recomendaram esse jogo. Ao ver algumas gameplays não achei nada de mais, porém, jamais julgue um jogo por uma gameplay, você tem que desfrutar pessoalmente para tirar suas próprias conclusões a respeito do jogo. Baixei o game e fui apreciar a jogabilidade, velhoooooo esse jogo é fhoda demais! Possui ótimos gráficos para sua geração, sem citar a história sensacional envolvida por trás do nosso querido e eterno Gordon freeman. Digo sem exageros que esse é de longe o melhor game que já joguei em toda minha vida. Super recomendo! Obs: "Já joguei a muito tempo atrás todos os jogos da franquia!"[/h1]

Parlare di Half-Life 2 significa discutere di uno dei più rivoluzionari e acclamati videogiochi della storia. Gordon Freeman viene risvegliato dal G-Man e catapultato a City 17, una delle tante cittadelle erette dai Combine in seguito alla loro invasione della Terra. Il suo scopo sarà sopravvivere in alcuni fra gli scenari più ostili del mondo e rovesciare il regime di Wallace Breen, una sua vecchia conoscenza di Black Mesa.
Ancora oggi si fa fatica a credere che un gioco con questo comparto tecnico risalga al lontano 2004. La prima interazione del Source Engine presenta degli elementi che oggigiorno sono standard, compresa una fisica di gioco a mio parere ancora senza eguali. Ogni singolo elemento è stato curato nei minimi particolari e il gameplay risulta sempre fresco e divertente. Complici l'ottima IA di nemici e alleati, ma soprattutto la Gravity Gun, arma peculiare con cui è possibile attrarre e respingere ogni singolo oggetto presente negli scenari. La sua presenza ci permette non solo di sbarazzarci delle forze nemiche in maniera creativa, ma soprattutto di risolvere i numerosi puzzle ambientali.
Le uniche critiche che sento di muovere a questo capolavoro videoludico, sono i frequenti caricamenti che spezzano l'azione e il doppiaggio italiano affidato a dei sintetizzatori vocali con risultati esilaranti.
Infine vorrei lasciare un messaggio al team di Valve: quando ci sarà concesso di godere della conclusione di questa storia? Voglio crederci e sperare di vedere in futuro Half-Life 3.

Half-Life 2-Одна из игр которая раньше была популярна и до сих пор и я решил попробовать сыграть уже даже не помню когда я последний раз играл в неё.В есть как минусы так и плюсы.Самый лучший плюс это то-что игра просто отлично,Игра с продуманам сюжетам, и самой атмосферой,персонажами.Игра шикарна!!! И мне не жалко тех денег которые я на нее потратил так что рекомендую!

Before i wasn't a fan of half life 2 and i never bothered to finish the game, now when i bought it again on steam and finished it i was woved by the game on alot of things like.
1. Creative level design that manages to always be fresh every level,
2. Graphics and Sound design are excellent
3. Story, voice acting, dialogues all excelent and also facial animations that hold up very good today that even manages to beat games like assassin creed odissey in terms of facial animations
4. AI is pretty good

Lets not forget the awesome weaponry in this game like gravity gun which is the best  weaponry introduced in this game which serves to solve puzzles, pick up large objects and kill even enemies with it (mostly undead but later in the game it is upgraded and it becomes so OP that its awesome).
And the enemies in this game are pretty challenging especialy the striders which are basically large terminators that are almost indestructible

Cons:
Only con is kind of pacing in  chapter 10 is not good but rest of the levels as always have excellent pacing except this level for me.

Коктейль «Белый русский» был назван в честь офицеров «Белой гвардии», которые сбежали за рубеж после проигрыша в гражданской битве. Западный народ прозвал из «white russians». Первоначальный вариант коктейля можно встретить в 1930 году. Однако тогда было несколько другое, не менее оригинальное название «Белый медведь». Готовился он из классической водки, джина и какао-ликера. Уже после 1950 года технологию решили усовершенствовать и добавили в международный список объединения барменов. После этого алкоголь носил название коктейль «Белый русский», которое сохранилось до нашего времени.
Состав и пропорции:

водка (без ароматизированных примесей) – две части;
кофейный ликер Калуа – одна часть;
свежие сливки – одна часть (заменой могут выступать взбитые сливки).
Ингредиенты:

традиционная водка — 50 мл.
сливки из коровьего молока (11%) – 25 мл.
кофейный ликер (Kahlua) – 25 мл.
кубики льда – 100 грамм.

This is possibly the greyest game ever released. More shades of grey than every collected on one screen before. Everything is grey...the sea, the land, the buildings, the sky. I know it's a bleak dystopian future but it seemed a bit spartan. That whine out of the way, let's deal with how good the game is.

I took about a month between finishing the game to writing this review, because I know i'm supposed to love this game and hail it as a top ten fps, but I didn't feel that way when I finished. I was a little disappointed and wanted to reflect on why. Was it a lesser game than HL1? Or was it just less than my expectation, but still a great game? 

Well...it is a good game, but it is no longer as amazing as it was initially hailed. That's fine, though, it is a 13 year old game and it still looks relatively good. A solid frame rate and no problems with running it on Win10. Essentially this is an fps on a rail and there are flaws and disappointments; there is only ever generally one way to go and only very slight deviations on how to get there, in this respect it seems to have less freedom than the previous game; the game tends to revolve around travel from one large pitched battle arena to another. These are not the only things that let the game down either; the puzzles are considerably easier and the gameplay isn't very varied, you are on a boat and a buggy, but that's about it, the rest of the time you are on foot except for the odd 5 seconds on a zip line or observing only from a rail. By the standards of today's games, this is a little uninventive. Even by contemporary standards, such as CoD: United Offensive (released in the same year) it has less varied gameplay. There you were in a plane, a jeep, a sidecar, a lorry, a boat and a tank. It's also a considerably shorter game than the first Half Life. 

Now don't get me wrong, much of this disappointment is actually rather small and it is also disappointment only in relation to expectations. The story is good, the weaponry is good and ammo is scare enough to need to think about which one you use, but the Gravity gun is an overloaded weapon to give you...happily though not always the best for each situation. The dystopian future that Dr Freeman has been called back into is wonderfully realised in some sections of the game. The initial city sections after arrival and processing look like something out of 1984 or Equilibrium and the Combine HQ human harvest rail run is a complete joy to watch roll by and observe. The buildings are atmospheric and there is a constant sense of chase and escape in the game that adds to the feeling of panic and fear that helps drive you along and to the momentary rest periods...it's just that there is something missing. That final bit of balance in the game that elevates it from a good game to a great one. The Highway 17 section is a good example of this. To be presented with the apparent freedom of a highway run seems amazing but it doesn't quite deliver. The road is so bland that SEGA's Outrun seems more glorious a backdrop and it's possible to avoid much of the trouble and to drive off the road without intending to because it's all so grey. What you get are tedious sections of drive between fixed place battles against the Combine. Again in the Combine HQ there is a section in an open central lift that is effectively little more than a static swarm shooting section...both examples are a bit of a let down and disappointingly too straightforward. 

All in all though this remains a good shooter, with some amazing sections, but no longer as great as contemporary reviews made out when laid against current expectations. Whilst this might seem unfair, people will only be reading this to consider purchasing the game today. The graphics undoubtedly wowed at the time as did the flexibility of the gravity gun. Today they look average and overall, this is a fine, but ultimately rather ordinary fps rail shooter. No doubt some of these comments will brand me as some sort of gaming apostate with the offended group thinkers for daring to find some faults or for not quietly hiding my mild disappointment, but there we are. At the retail price of £7 though, there really isn't any reason not to recommend this game and at that price you will certainly enjoy it...go get it Gordon.

I played this game for the first time now in 2018, and even after all those years after its release in 2004, it's an excellent game even if you're not a fan of HL. I would argue that the first HL was better in terms of its setting (New Mexico labs) than this Eastern European, Orwellian city, but hey.. it's a great game.
